CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 30, 1954, pg. 1, reads: "$28,000 Fire Damages Homes - A six alarm fire, which firemen said started from an overheated furnace in 1560 1/2 North Murtland Street, left seven heartbroken families without shelter Saturday morning, as it spread with vicious swiftness through the 1500 block and did and estimated damage of $28,000, according to Deputy Fire Chief Charles J. McDermott. Less than two months ago, the first of the seven families moved into the two-story brick and frame row.  In most families, the only possessions salvaged were the clothes they were wearing. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Two of seven two story brick row houses destroyed by fire, 1500 block North Murtland Street, Homewood
